content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
Due to guidelines set by the governments regarding the operation ceiling of civil drones, road-tracking based navigation is garnering interest.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The passage is written at a complexity level that may be considered too high for a university student. It contains technical terms like "operation ceiling" and "road-tracking based navigation," which may not be easily understood without prior knowledge. Thus, the text is above the desired complexity (DC).
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes.
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "operation ceiling of civil drones" is complicated and could be simplified.
Simplify this section
Simplified section: "limits on how high civil drones can fly."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
Revised passage: "Due to guidelines set by the governments regarding the limits on how high civil drones can fly, road-tracking based navigation is garnering interest."
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

Information loss: The phrase "operation ceiling" is more technical and precise than "limits on how high civil drones can fly." While the simplified version conveys the main idea, it loses the nuance of regulatory implications implied by "operation ceiling," which may refer specifically to legal or safety thresholds.

Severity: Low. The core message remains intact, as both phrases refer to the same underlying concept of height limits for drones. However, some specificity regarding regulatory aspects may be lost. Given the ILT (Medium), this change is acceptable.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No.
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text
Adjusted passage for readability and flow: "Due to government guidelines on the limits of how high civil drones can fly, there is growing interest in road-tracking based navigation."
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The adjusted passage is now at a complexity level suitable for a university student. It uses simpler language and maintains clarity while conveying the main idea. Thus, it is at or below the desired complexity (DC).
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No.
Provide the final version of the simplified passage
Final simplified passage: "Due to government guidelines on the limits of how high civil drones can fly, there is growing interest in road-tracking based navigation."
